etymologies: Middle English: from Old French bourrache, from medieval Latin borrago, perhaps from Arabic 'abū ḥurāš ‘father of roughness’ (referring to the leaves)

definitions: a herbaceous plant with bright blue flowers and hairy leaves, used medicinally and as a salad green.

notes.text: Borago officinalis, family Boraginaceae (the borage family). This family includes many plants that typically have blue or purple flowers, including forget-me-not, comfrey, and bugloss

shortDefinitions: European herbaceous plant with bright blue flowers and hairy leaves
